name: Jon Secada
description:
'''Juan Francisco Secada Ram√≠rez''' (born October 4, 1961), better known as '''Jon Secada''', is a [[Cuba|Cuban]]-born American singer, songwriter, actor and record producer. He has won two [[Grammy Award]]s and sold 15 million records, making him one of the [[List of best-selling Latin music artists|best-selling Latin music artists]]. His music fuses [[funk]], [[soul music]], pop, and Latin percussion.

Secada has written songs for [[Gloria Estefan]], [[Ricky Martin]], and [[Jennifer Lopez]]. He has toured with [[Luciano Pavarotti]] and recorded duets with [[Jim Brickman]], [[Olivia Newton-John]], and [[Frank Sinatra]].

Secada has performed several times at ''[[A Capitol Fourth]]'', an annual [[Independence Day (United States)|Independence Day]] concert from the [[United States Capitol]].
